channel.title: Rstan on R, it's OK I guess
channel.description: Recent content in Rstan on R, it's OK I guess

item.title: Working my way back to you, a re-investigation of rstan
item.description: Introduction I learned Stan a while back, when I was fitting some Bayesian models. I wanted to fix up one of them, and I realized that I had forgotten most of what I knew about Stan, so I had to go back and learn it again. A Bayesian model has two parts: a prior distribution, which summarizes your belief about the parameters you are trying to estimate before you look at any data, and a model that asserts the data-generating mechanism conditional on the parameter value(s).
